exception aria.orchestrator.exceptions.ActiveExecutionsErrorÂ¶

Bases: aria.exceptions.AriaError

load_plugin(plugin, env=None)Â¶

Load the plugin into an environment.

Loading the plugin means the pluginâs code and binaries paths will be appended to the environmentâs PATH and PYTHONPATH, thereby allowing usage of the plugin.

Parameters:
  • plugin â plugin to load
  • env â environment to load the plugin into; If None, os.environ will be used
static validate_plugin(source)Â¶

Validate a plugin archive.

A valid plugin is a wagon in the zip format (suffix may also be .wgn).

aria.orchestrator.execution_preparerÂ¶

class aria.orchestrator.execution_preparer.ExecutionPreparer(model_storage, resource_storage, plugin_manager, service, workflow_name, task_max_attempts=None, task_retry_interval=None)Â¶

Bases: object

This class manages any execution and tasks related preparation for an execution of a workflow.

get_workflow_ctx(execution)Â¶
prepare(execution_inputs=None, executor=None, execution_id=None)Â¶

If there is a need to prepare a new execution (e.g. execution_id is not provided), a new execution and task models are created. Any any case, a corresponding workflow context is returned.

Parameters:
  • execution_inputs â inputs for the execution.
  • executor â the execution for the tasks
  • execution_id â used for an existing execution (mainly for resuming).
Returns:
